alert.note: Alert for Washington (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 24 at 12:50PM EDT until March 27 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Flooding of Duck Creek. * WHEN...Until 545 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1250 PM EDT, At 1230 PM EDT, the automated gauge on Duck Creek at Macksburg indicated the creek level just over 13 feet and slowly rising. Up to 2 inches of rainfall has fallen in the Duck Creek Basin this morning and light rain is expected to continue into this afternoon. At 13 feet, Main Street, near the creek, floods. State Route 821, near the intersection with Main Street, begins to flood. Fields adjacent to creek flood. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Macksburg and Lower Salem. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
